# Descriptive Statistics

## Goal

:::{style="text-align:justify"}

The goal of this session is to introduce the basic concepts of descriptive analysis, focusing on how to summarize and present data in meaningful ways. By the end of this chapter, students will:

-   Be able to describe variables using both graphical and numerical methods

:::

## What is Descriptive Analysis

:::{style="text-align:justify"}

Descriptive analysis is a statistical method used to summarize and describe the main features of a dataset. It provides a simple overview of the data, highlighting key aspects such as central tendency, variability, and distribution. This type of analysis is essential for understanding the basic characteristics of the data before applying more complex statistical methods.

Descriptive methods can be categorized into two types:

:::

-   Graphical Descriptive Methods

-   Numerical Descriptive Methods

:::{style="text-align:justify"}

In the following chapters, we will describe each of these methods in detail. Let's deepen your understanding of graphical and numerical descriptive methods, as well as how to implement these techniques using R.

:::
